review_title: Global Vice president of products and operations

job_title: Head of Internal Communications in Montreal, QC
pros: Learning new skills and being able to drive comms for over 40k young people across 120+ countries is a new level of experience.
cons: It was a one year position only.

review_title: VP Corporate Relations at AIESEC York
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Toronto, ON
pros: Amazing personal and professional development opportunity working within AIESEC. Leadership opportunities are always arising and if you are the type of person who is looking to go far within the organization, be sure to take these opportunities, develop relationships, grow your network, and work hard!
cons: Being a university club, of course this position was unpaid. Also, as a VP, you don't have full control over who is on your team, but again, that is a very realistic situation which you will face working for any company.

job_title: LCVP Incomng Exchange in Montreal, QC
pros: Best place to learn about management and leadership. It has been a life changing experience for me, and will sure apply what I learn in my professionnal career.
cons: If you are not autonomous or willing to progress by yourself, then this organisation is not for you. It's not about pulling up but pushing people up.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Milton, ON
pros: If you put enough effort into working for the organization, you'll learn some really great, transferable skills. Also, really recommend attending the conferences - it's a great way to network and meet individuals who are like-minded.
cons: Certain positions can be very demanding in terms of workload for a volunteer position, but it'll definitely teach you to time management.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Waterloo, ON
pros:
-  Friendly environment 
- Motivating 
- Encourage to help leadership skills
- Push you out of the comfort zone
- Supporting team
- Allows you to work in a dynamic environment
cons:
- Demanding 
- Executive team does not always c omply with decisions

job_title: Local Chapter Vice President in Toronto, ON
pros: amazing culture, alot of diversity and the people are very friendly. the organization also circles around a great cause and there are many opportunities
cons: sometimes it is a bit slow and the national team is often too busy to actually help you when you do need it.

review_title: I oversee all activities regarding customer attraction and public relations

job_title: National Director in Toronto, ON
pros: As an art student, I learned all my marketing and management skills through AIESEC. What's more, it allowed me to get to know people from all over the world!
cons: It could get disorganized sometimes but hey, it is a student-for-student organization.

job_title: V President Corporate Relationships in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Great networking opportunity, lots of leaderships opportunity and opportunities to build soft skills, you get what you put into it, global perspective, high achievers, travel opportunities, great life experience
cons: can be a bit clicky and stump professional development of others. basically a cult

review_title: One of the worst mistakes you can make
job_title: Manager in Montreal, QC
pros: You get the opportunity to practice some business soft skills like public speaking.
cons: The company is more like a cult then anything else. Most works work for free and will have to pay for expensive conferences. The organization is poorly organized and pushes workers to the point of breaking down. Employee turn over is almost 100% year over year. The only people who continue working are those with the highest positions.

job_title: Corporate Sales Representative in Toronto, ON
pros: Great work culture and a lot of room for personal and professional growth.
cons: Non-paid work. Time consuming and stressful at times.

job_title: Local Branch President in Toronto, ON
pros: This is nothing short of a perfect organization. People care, people want you to grow - you walk in AIESEC and come out a completely different person. Amazing!
cons: Perhaps more organized approach to delivering the experiences.

review_title: Great organization, work for a good cause
job_title: Corporate Relations in Toronto, ON

cons: Can be a little bit disorganized at times.
